name: sysml-2ls
description: SysML v2 language support in VS Code.

scripts.build: pnpm run typecheck && pnpm run esbuild
scripts.watch: concurrently -n tsc,esbuild -c blue,yellow "pnpm run typecheck -w" "pnpm run esbuild:watch"
scripts.esbuild: concurrently -n node,web -c blue,yellow "pnpm run esbuild-base:node --minify" "pnpm run esbuild-base:browser --minify"
scripts.esbuild:watch: concurrently -n node,web -c blue,yellow "pnpm run esbuild:node --watch" "pnpm run esbuild:browser --watch"

commands.shortTitle: Dump AST of the current selection
commands.title: SysIDE Editor Legacy: Dump AST of the current selection in the active text editor

commands.shortTitle: Dump Meta of the current selection
commands.title: SysIDE Editor Legacy: Dump Meta of the current selection in the active text editor
SysIDE Editor Legacy: Update current document

commands.shortTitle: Get MRO of the current node
commands.title: SysIDE Editor Legacy: Get MRO of the current node

commands.shortTitle: Get S-expression of the current node
commands.title: SysIDE Editor Legacy: Get S-expression of the current node

commands.shortTitle: Get children of the current node
commands.title: SysIDE Editor Legacy: Get all direct, inherited and imported children of the current node

commands.shortTitle: Get elements in scope of the current node
commands.title: SysIDE Editor Legacy: Get all elements in scope of the current node
SysIDE Editor Legacy: Evaluate the selected expression or feature value

commands.shortTitle: Get all available language server commands
commands.title: SysIDE Editor Legacy: Get all available language server commands

syside.editor.trace.server.description: Server trace level, implicitly used by the default VS Code LanguageClient

syside.editor.standardLibrary.description: If true, parse the bundled standard library

syside.editor.standardLibraryPath.description: If set, use this path to import standard library files

syside.editor.logStatistics.description: If true, build times will be reported

syside.editor.defaultBuildOptions.valida.description: Which validation checks are enabled for files

syside.editor.defaultBuildOptions.ignore.description: If set, ignore all metamodel errors

enumDescriptions: skip setting up relationships to the standard library elements
use standard library elements from the document locally, useful for testing
syside.editor.defaultBuildOptions.standa.description:
Set type of standard library:
 'none' - skip setting up relationships to the standard library elements
 'standard' - use default standard library
 'local' - use standard library elements from the document locally, useful for testing

syside.editor.debug.scopeInLinkingErrors.description: Append elements in scope to linking errors

syside.editor.debug.stacktraceInLinkingE.description: Append stacktrace to thrown errors while resolving references

items.description: Path to a .js script or directory of .js scripts

syside.editor.plugins.description:
Additional plugin paths (.js scripts or directories with .js scripts)
that will be loaded on server start-up

syside.editor.client.extensions.description: VS Code extensions that extend the language client

syside.editor.server.args.run.description: Command line interface arguments in release mode

syside.editor.server.args.debug.description: Command line interface arguments in debug mode

syside.editor.server.path.description: Server entry path, relative paths will be resolved from the first workspace folder

syside.editor.skipWorkspaceInit.description:
Skip collecting files matching extensions in the current workspace on
startup

syside.editor.defaultBuildOptions.standa.description:
If true, the document will be built isolated from all the other
documents, i.e. no indexing, no global scope. It's main use is for
testing so that each new built file doesn't pollute the global scope and
influence other test results.

syside.editor.formatting.null_expression.description:
Controls `NullExpression` formatting:
* `null`: always formatted as `null`
* `brackets`: always formatted as `()`

Controls formatting in majority of cases.
* `preserve`: element preserves source text formatting

Controls `NullExpression` formatting:
* `null`: always formatted as `null`
* `brackets`: always formatted as `()`

Controls `preserve` formatting for cases when there is no associated
source text.

syside.editor.formatting.literal_real.description:
Controls `LiteralReal` formatting. Only applies to those numbers that are
not in the source text.

syside.editor.formatting.strip_unnecessa.description:
Controls identifier formatting. If true, strips quotes from identifiers
if the name doesn't have restricted characters

syside.editor.formatting.sequence_expres.description:
Controls `SequenceExpression` formatting. If true, sequence expressions
will be printed with a trailing comma if broken.

syside.editor.formatting.operator_break.description:
Controls binary operator placement on line breaks.
* `after`: operators are placed on the same line as the LHS expression
* `before`: operators are placed on the same line as the RHS expression

syside.editor.formatting.bracket_spacing.description: If true, adds a space around brackets on a single line

syside.editor.formatting.comment_keyword.description:
Controls `comment` keyword formatting:
* `always`: `comment` will always be printed
* `as_needed`: `comment` will only be printed as needed

Controls formatting in majority of cases.
* `preserve`: element preserves source text formatting

Controls `comment` keyword formatting:
* `always`: `comment` will always be printed
* `as_needed`: `comment` will only be printed as needed

Controls `preserve` formatting for cases when there is no associated
source text.

syside.editor.formatting.comment_about_b.description:
Controls line break preceding `about` in `Comment`:
* `always`: about list is always on a new line
* `as_needed`: printer tries to fit about list on the previous line

syside.editor.formatting.markdown_commen.description:
Controls `Comment` and `Documentation` body formatting. If true, trailing
whitespace is preserved on each line but last.

syside.editor.formatting.textual_represe.description:
Controls `rep` keyword formatting:
* `always`: `rep` will always be printed
* `as_needed`: `rep` will only be printed as needed

Controls formatting in majority of cases.
* `preserve`: element preserves source text formatting

Controls `rep` keyword formatting:
* `always`: `rep` will always be printed
* `as_needed`: `rep` will only be printed as needed

Controls `preserve` formatting for cases when there is no associated

Controls line break preceding `language` in `TextualRepresentation`:
* `always`: language is always on a new line
* `as_needed`: printer tries to fit language on the previous line

syside.editor.formatting.empty_namespace.description:
Controls formatting of empty children blocks:
* `always`: empty blocks are always formatted as `{}`
* `never`: empty blocks are always formatted as `;`

Controls formatting in majority of cases.
* `preserve`: element preserves source text formatting

Controls formatting of empty children blocks:
* `always`: empty blocks are always formatted as `{}`
* `never`: empty blocks are always formatted as `;`

Controls `preserve` formatting for cases when there is no associated
source text.

syside.editor.formatting.merge_declarati.description:
Controls disjoining formatting in type declarations. If true, all
disjoinings are merged into a single group. Requires KerML.

syside.editor.formatting.merge_unioning.description:
Controls unioning formatting in type declarations. If true, all unionings
are merged into a single group. Requires KerML.

syside.editor.formatting.merge_intersect.description:
Controls intersecting formatting in type declarations. If true, all
intersectings are merged into a single group. Requires KerML.

syside.editor.formatting.merge_differenc.description:
Controls differencing formatting in type declarations. If true, all
differencings are merged into a single group. Requires KerML.

syside.editor.formatting.merge_feature_c.description:
Controls feature chaining formatting in feature declarations. If true,
all feature chainings are merged into a single group. Requires KerML.

syside.editor.formatting.merge_declarati.description:
Controls type featuring formatting in feature declarations. If true, all
type featurings are merged into a single group. Requires KerML.

syside.editor.formatting.feature_value_e.description:
Controls feature value equals token formatting whenever it can be
omitted:
* `as_needed`: `=` will only be printed if it is required by the grammar
* `always`: `=` will be always printed when it is acceptable by the
  grammar

Controls formatting in majority of cases.
* `preserve`: element preserves source text formatting

  grammar

source text.

syside.editor.formatting.multiplicity_pl.description:
Controls multiplicity placement in type declarations:
* `first`: multiplicity is printed before any specializations
* `first-specialization`: multiplicity is printed after the first
  specialization
* `last`: multiplicity is printed after all specializations
